text:
Time
spent by employees in participating in fire or other disaster drills, whether
voluntary or involuntary or during or after regular working hours, is
considered substantially to the benefit of the employer and therefore is
compensable hours of work. Of course, such time may be compensated at the
applicable statutory MW rather than the employees’ regular rates.
html: Time spent by employees in participating in fire or other disaster drills, whether voluntary or involuntary or during or after regular working hours, is considered substantially to the benefit of the employer and therefore is compensable hours of work. Of course, such time may be compensated at the applicable statutory MW rather than the employees’ regular rates.
